If you get some water in chocolate, what happens
is the chocolate seizes.

Because it has gone from nice, liquidy, shiny
to it's this gooey, gunky, almost grainy mixture.

Now there's not a lot that you can do with
that, in terms of if you were intending to

use it as coating for cake pops or something
like that.
You can't fix it to use for that.

But, you don't need to throw the chocolate
out.

You can still use it to make things like ganache
or chocolate sauce or that sort of thing.

What you need to do in fact is simply add
more water or more hot cream in order to take

it back from this lumpy texture that it has
back to normal.

OK we'll just stir in some hot cream into
our seized chocolate.

And that has made a beautiful ganache quite
normally, just like you would have a normal

If you want it thinner you can add more cream
and you have saved your seized chocolate.
